sentences.english: A: I report to the Shift Supervisor, and he reports to the Factory Manager.
sentences.chinese: 我向值班主任報告，他向廠長報告。

sentences.english: The question of replacing the director bulks large with the committee.
sentences.chinese: 替換廠長這個問題對於委員會來說顯得很重要。

sentences.english: I report to the Shift Supervisor, and he reports to the Factory Manager.
sentences.chinese: 我向值班主任報告，他向廠長報告。

sentences.english: Golden flowers to the food factory jobs, what accidentally met the directors son.
sentences.chinese: 金花到食品廠打工還債，偶然結識了廠長的兒子楊帆。

sentences.english: The factory manager let the workers off for a week.
sentences.chinese: 廠長給工人們放了一週的假。

sentences.english: Zhang Degang-the factory director with all employee await respectively each friend's presence.
sentences.chinese: 廠長張德剛攜全廠職工恭候各位朋友光臨指導。

sentences.english: He was fired by the newly-appointed director.
sentences.chinese: 他被新來的廠長炒了魷魚。

sentences.english: The production manager introduced a new water-repellent gypsum additive.
sentences.chinese: 廠長引進了一種新的石膏防水劑。

sentences.english: Beijing Film Studio 80's former Deputy Factory Manager.
sentences.chinese: 80年代曾任北京電影製片廠副廠長。

sentences.english: To work for sales administration under the supervision of FAC manager in Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 在身處北京的廠長的監督下，從事營銷管理工作。

sentences.english: Assist PM in translation and other activities.
sentences.chinese: 協助廠長完成文件翻譯工作及相關事情。

sentences.english: Proposals for discussion of the foregoing important issues shall all be made by the factory director.
sentences.chinese: 上述重大問題的討論方案，均由廠長提出。

sentences.english: Gengyanfengs current director of the Taiyuan Tool Factory, deputy secretary of the party committee.
sentences.chinese: 邢巖峯同志現任太原工具廠廠長，黨委副書記。

sentences.english: He was named director of the plant after liberation .
sentences.chinese: 解放後，他被任命爲這個廠的廠長。

sentences.english: The workers made the young man vice-director of the factory.
sentences.chinese: 工人們推選這年輕人當副廠長。

sentences.english: They made the girl vice—director of the factory.
sentences.chinese: 他們讓這位姑娘當上副廠長。

definition: to hold an office or post
Chen Yi (1901-1972), communist general and politician, Marshal of PLA from 1955, Mayor of Shanghai in 1950s, PRC foreign minister 1958-1972
special duty/assigned full time to a task
Chen Yun (1905-1995), communist leader and economist
surname Jiang/refers to Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石
